relieve.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings
relieve.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
Some people eat for comfort, to relieve their anxieties.
relieve.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make a problem less difficult or serious
relieve.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to replace someone when they have completed their duty or when they need a rest
relieve.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The guard will be relieved at midnight.
relieve.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to make something less dull and boring
relieve.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: a plain wall relieved by flecks of blue and yellow
The books helped relieve the boredom of waiting.
relieve.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to free a town which an enemy has surrounded
relieve.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: What’s the best way of relieving back pain?
Drinking a pint of water should help to relieve the symptoms.
They all laughed and it helped to relieve the tension.
Don’t resort to alcohol to relieve your stress.
We offer patients a gentle massage to help relieve anxiety.
Doctors should have inserted a needle into the lungs to relieve the pressure.
relieve.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make a bad situation less severe
relieve.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Its Japanese parent company is expected to inject capital to relieve its crushing $3 billion debt.
